formattedAddress: 47 Bond St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 47 Bond St, New York, NY 10012, USA

editorialSummary.text: Upmarket, carefully sourced Mediterranean plates served in a rustic-chic space with a wine cellar.

originalText.text:
Il Buco is a beautiful Spanish restaurant filled w rustic charm, delicious food, and perfect service. We had the olive oil sampler, Gambas, Salad, Bikini Sandwiches, and sherry and white wine. Go soon because they have a free glass of champagne during their 30th anniversary.
I can’t wait to go back to this restaurant.

I can’t wait to go back to this restaurant.

originalText.text:
December 2023
My friend and I back here again for great wine. We were waiting for next door to available, so we decided to hang out here first. I Could eat here at I saw they have lots of nice menu but my best friend who is super crazy about food demanded to go to the next place so I'm very easy person just go with it. Service is always nice and professional. With out my friend I will come back to try great food next time.

2019
Il Buco is next to the restaurant that my friend and I went to have a dinner. Looks from the outside this place is very attractive then we stepped in and we spent time in il buco for couple hours, lol. We had several drinks, met some interesting people, had a nice conversation and enjoyed my evening so much. We didn't eat there but from what we talked to another people, they all say food here is very delicious and I will definitely try to eat here next time:) nice drinks and nice interior!

originalText.text: My wife and I've eaten here numerous times. This is one of if not my favorite restaurant in Manhattan. The polenta with poached egg and iberico pork shoulder with brocolini were as good as it gets. The bread is also homemade and the atmosphere feels like you are eating in an Italian countryside kitchen. Bravo, Il Buco, see you soon.

text.text: My wife and I've eaten here numerous times. This is one of if not my favorite restaurant in Manhattan. The polenta with poached egg and iberico pork shoulder with brocolini were as good as it gets. The bread is also homemade and the atmosphere feels like you are eating in an Italian countryside kitchen. Bravo, Il Buco, see you soon.

originalText.text:
I recently dined at IL Buco, a wonderful Italian restaurant that truly impressed me. The authenticity of the cuisine was undeniable, with each dish radiating the essence of homemade goodness. The restaurant's commitment to using fresh, high-quality ingredients was evident in every bite, and the presentation of the dishes was impeccable.

Nestled in a cozy and tranquil setting, IL Buco offered a delightful ambiance that added to the overall experience. The extensive wine list showcased their dedication to providing a complete culinary journey, and the servers were not only friendly but also knowledgeable. Our server's expertise in wine pairings enhanced our meal, creating a perfect harmony of flavors.

One standout dish was the tagliatelle with truffles, a true masterpiece of flavors and freshness. The rich aroma and taste of truffles combined with the impeccable texture of the tagliatelle left a lasting impression. Equally exceptional was the ceviche, crafted with precision and featuring impeccable cuts of seafood that were flawlessly prepared. The buratta was fresh and delicious as well. The sweet cherries were a great accompaniment to the cheese.

Even the simplest details were executed perfectly, as seen in the freshly baked bread served with high-quality olive oil. The restaurant's charm extended beyond the culinary offerings; it boasted a great ambiance situated on a quiet street and maintained impeccable cleanliness.

The service at IL Buco was second to none, characterized by its excellence and efficiency. Whether it's a romantic date or a gathering with friends, the restaurant's inviting vibe makes it suitable for various occasions. While the prices may align with typical New York standards, the quality of the experience undoubtedly justifies the cost.

In summary, I wholeheartedly recommend IL Buco to anyone seeking an authentic Italian dining experience that excels in every aspect. The combination of fresh, flavorful dishes, a welcoming atmosphere, and attentive service make it a standout choice among New York's dining scene.

originalText.text:
My experience at il Buco was mediocre. I had high expectations due to the good reviews online. Though I was slightly disappointed. The bread was not complimentary and it was just okay. The tartare was good and was the highlight of the dinner. The short rib was good and there was a solid amount of short rib. The spaghetti with shrimp had only one shrimp in it although the flavors were unique and nice. Finally the service was just meh. Sure they came around but it wasn’t great.

Overall, it’s okay. Not really worth it as there are better places that have better food and probably also cheaper.
